content.description: Follow positive edges into a layback crack/seam.  Move briefly right around an arete into a groove, then back left through a small scoop.  Finish on pockets and edges up the steep headwall.

Start up the nicely-featured slab, then step briefly into the easy corner.  The first crux comes pulling out of the corner onto the face just above the 5th bolt, crossing through to a right-hand pebble pinch from a good left-hand sidepull.  The second crux comes just before the end making a long move from a jug rail to a good pinch.
content.location: Middle route, starting on the left side of the slab.

content.description:
The warm-up at Crystal Lake.  Start up the slab/arete, pull a small bulge, then pull the crux past the 5th bolt on some hidden pockets.  Finish slapping up another arete to the chains.

Depending on how closely you stick to the bolt line, this route is probably anywhere from 5.7 to 5.9.    Climbing a bit left or right, particularly on the second half, will make this route feel easier.
content.location: Second route from the right side of the crag.

content.description: Climb the cool stemming corner then join "Crystal Light" at its 5th bolt.  Again, a little easier if you go right of the bolt rather than staying direct.

Bouldery start with a shallow three-finger pocket and small edges.  At the third bolt, step right, moving towards the left-facing corner/seam.  Crux is pulling past a small left-hand sidepull to a positive rail.  Continue up the corner system to a sloping ledge, finishing up the steep headwall on scoops and flat slopers.
